enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Students must have completed CHEM 103-0 or 171-0 and MATH 224-0 to register for this course.
title: WCAS ENVR_SCI 203-0-20 Energy and the Environment

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: We are faced with major global challenges involving the sustainable use of resources and stewardship of the environment. These include sustainable energy production and its impacts on other resources. This course will be an introduction to this topic, focusing on the science behind it and approaches to engineering relevant solutions.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
1. Research information in the scientific peer reviewed literature
2. Assemble and synthesize information to answer research questions
3. Clearly communicate information in written formats
4. Identify the major environmental issues associated with energy use
5. Identify and describe engineering solutions to environment issues
6. Perform fundamental physical-chemical calculations that constrain the energy-environment system

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Two 1.5 hour lectures/week plus a required discussion section.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Progress in the course will be monitored by a series of problem sets, class activities and exams.
